response.content:
I found you that you are another Instructor and gave a fake rating. Thank you very much.

Thanks for giving mis-understood / misleading review.
1. The course covers very advanced concepts.
2. Angular 8 features will be explained in a video, added soon. Angular 8 just has very few new features to explain, such as better support for web workers, and improved compilation model. At 99%, it shares all the concepts of Angular 7.
3. As per the course description, RxJS essentials (Observables, Observers, Custom RxJS Observables, Subscription, Subject, BehaviorSubject, Subscribe / Unsubscribe, Using Observables, Subject etc., in Services) are already covered; you have to check them.

There are lot of other benefits of the course, you missed, such as straight-to-the-point, no wastage of time, clear integration with server side program, comprehensive / complete course content, real-world app development, security and REST-API calls integration are the main highlights.

response.content:
Thanks Mohit for providing a positive review. Your happiness boosts me to create wonderful courses.
- Tone is not robotic; but it's up to you.
- Course is up to date, all the scripts work, if you write code correctly.
- In this course, I have used Asp.Net Core Mvc; as any one server side framework (either of Asp.Net Mvc / Asp.Net Core Mvc / Python / Java) should be used to make the examples meaningful. I have used Asp.Net Core Mvc as I have as per the course description. For Angular learners, the code for Asp.Net Core Mvc is NOT concerned; you can just ignore asp.net core code only focus on Angular. I mentioned the same comment in the video and course description also. How can you understand Asp.Net core code, if you don't know it. In real projects, angular developers doesn't write code of asp.net core mvc; Isn't it?
- My another course of "Asp.Net Mvc" doesn't cover "Asp.Net Core Mvc".
Continue watching the course, you will like it more.
